الامن

description:
The Youth Summit: The Leap
Egypt’s most powerful youth experience built by and for 18–29 years old ready to take their next leap.

For 2 unforgettable days, you won’t just sit and listen. You’ll connect face-to-face with 100+ game-changers from Egypt and the region athletes, entrepreneurs, CEOs, creators, artists, and more here to talk with you, not at you. Every moment is designed to feel raw, unfiltered, and real. It’s your chance to live an experience to be part of the energy, the people, and the movement shaping what’s next.

What Awaits At The Youth Summit
Authentic Storytelling That Feels Real
Hear Egyptians and regional voices open up about the untold parts of their journeys the failures, pivots, and struggles that shaped their biggest leaps forward. No filters, just truths you can actually relate to.

Live Startup Pitch Competition (With Audience Power)
Think Shark Tank, but closer, louder, and bolder. Startups will pitch live on stage, battle for investment and recognition and for the first time, the audience gets a vote in deciding who wins. Your voice will help crown the winning startup.

Interactive Workshops & Mentor Matchmaking
Roll up your sleeves for hands-on skill sessions and mentorship matchmaking. Meet mentors who actually get what you’re going through. Leave with tactics, connections, and the confidence to take your next step immediately.

NextGenSpace: Where Brands & Youth Collide
Step into a playground of collaboration featuring brands that speak your language Adidas, Saints, Elevate, and more to come.

Collaboration Zones & Immersive Experiences
Relax, connect, and experiment in curated zones built for creativity. Expect surprises, pop-ups, and activations that all centered on values, culture, and the conversations that matter to you.

For AUC Students, please login using your AUC email to get the discounted tickets.

الامن

description: At its heart, Tá Brón Orm is a metaphoric narrative — an expression of global grief over the loss of language and culture through extreme social and political upheaval, rooted in the context of historical Ireland. In Irish, Tá Brón Orm is how we say “I’m sorry,” yet its direct translation is “Sadness is upon me.” This sadness sits heavy on the body, a weight passed down through generations. It can be shed, like an item of clothing — not sorrow for our own actions, but for the transformations of the land we call home. Inspired by the Children of the Famine novel trilogy and set to music by OXN, a contemporary Irish alternative folk band, this new trio blends movement, story, and history. Original short stories by Michael McEvoy and costumes by Nashwa Maatouck frame a collaboration with dancers Ahmed Ghareeb, Shady Abdelrahman, and Sara Gabr. This work was created and produced as part of the international exchange “Our Voice Together Now,” a collaboration between Orient Productions (Egypt), Sareyyet Ramallah (Palestine), and the Belfast International Arts Festival (Northern Ireland) with the support of the British Council.

description:
Get ready for the 46th show of "Ain Gamal" at MedFest Egypt!


"Ain Gamal" is back again for its 46th performance in the 7th edition of MedFest Egypt, in collaboration with Bécarre Arts and Kamikaze Pictures! This isn’t just any comedy show; it’s all about the interaction between "Omar El Gamal" and the audience. Come with energy, ready to share your stories so we can hear them and laugh from the heart!


Join us on Friday, September 19th at 9:00 pm, at the historic Ewart Hall at The American University in Cairo-Tahrir Square.


The show is not included in the full ticket for MedFest Egypt.

description:
A massive #ElectricThursday is coming — September 25th marks 20 years of Junior behind our decks, and it calls for a celebration like no other!


Joining him on this milestone are international standouts Nadia Boulif with her signature sets mixing melodic, organic, and tribal house, and PAAX, the electrifying duo blending Latin roots with global electronic sounds.


Alongside powerhouse locals Cox, Deemusik, Dou, and Joe Aiaad, it’s a lineup that promises nothing short of phenomenal, fueled by Afro house and melodic techno all night long.

description:
Lena Chamamyan returns to Cairo with a magical concert at Theatro on Thursday, October 2, titled “Sohab” (Mates).

On this special night, Lena will launch her new album, Sohab—her first release in nearly 10 years. The songs are inspired by her personal experiences and created in collaboration with musicians from Egypt and across the Arab world—friends who have supported her through various phases of life.

The concert will feature Lena’s most beloved older songs alongside fresh new tracks, performed with her talented band and special guest artists.

Sohab is a musical journey and a new chapter in Lena’s artistic and personal path, shaped by her travels and time spent living in different countries. Through it, she invites us to celebrate life, love, home, and the people who walk beside us.

This is more than a concert—it’s a heartfelt thank-you to the “Sohab” who stand by us through both joy and hardship. A night of music, magic, and connection straight from the soul.

An evening of soulful journeys from Italy to Norway:

Rachele Andrioli (Italy) at Main Garden (7:00–8:00 pm) opens with “Leuca” — a solo performance weaving her powerful voice with harp, tambourines, flutes, strings, and loop station. Sanyu (Norway) at Main Garden (8:00–9:00 pm) follows with a soundscape of soulful R&B, jazz, and electronic grooves. Backed by some of Norway’s most exciting young musicians, she brings warm harmonies, spoken word, and explosive energy to the stage

description:
3 Interrupted is a bold, experimental performance that fuses physical theatre, raw dialogue, and choreographed disruption. Born from intimate conversations between three Egyptian artists, the piece explores the challenges of performance-making today—amid cultural expectations, economic pressure, and the invisible labor of survival under capitalism.

Both humorous and vulnerable, the work dismantles para-Orientalist narratives and confronts the politics of cultural translation. Ultimately, interruption becomes a tool: for protest, connection, and artistic resistance.

description:

Join us on October 5th at Ewart Hall ,The American University in Tahrir, for a night filled with soul, emotions, and timeless artistry, accompanied by a full orchestra conducted by Maestro Wagdy El Fiwy.
Aida El Ayoubi, the Egyptian artist of Egyptian–German roots, first captured hearts in the 1990s with her iconic debut album “Ala Bali”, a groundbreaking success that surpassed all expectations. She has continued to shine through her singing, composing, and songwriting, while connecting with new generations by collaborating with young bands and artists from diverse musical backgrounds. Her music remains relevant and inspiring today, sampled by contemporary musicians and enriched by her continuous production of new works that reflect her unique artistry.
Don’t miss the festival’s final night… a night of art, nostalgia, and inspiration

description:
Cairo Jazz Club 610 is collaborating with Hence Management on Friday, Oct. 10th for an exciting sonic experience featuring regional talent CHAMOS!


Kurdish-Dutch rooted duo CHAMOS bring a powerful sound shaped by percussion, bass, and West Asian influences, blending tradition with electronic elements. Their renowned club edits have become a favorite among DJs worldwide, and their sets embody the spirit of their name—“friends”—uniting diverse sounds and people together on the dance floor.


Joining the lineup is Jaadu, serving up his infectious SWANA-infused remixes of hip hop, amapiano, Brazilian funk, and more, while Warda El Barda opens the night with a sleek mix of minimal tech and tech house. Closing out, Lana B2B Rajia join forces, merging Lana’s garage, dancehall, and amapiano selections with Rajia’s playful, bass-heavy energy for a finale packed with rhythm, sass, and unpredictability.

description:
What if creativity isn’t who you are, but what you’re willing to become? Not a fixed identity, but a constant shift across tools, disciplines, and ways of thinking. This year, SYNC Summit is embracing that shift with a theme that mirrors the moment: Creative Range.


From October 30 to November 1 at O West, experience three immersive days of insight, practice, and real connection. Expect high-impact talks, skills-based workshops, curated portfolio reviews, and hands-on labs led by top voices across the creative economy.


SYNC Summit is designed for every stage of your journey—whether you’re launching your first project or leading your tenth. It’s not about staying in your lane—it’s about pushing the limits of your range, learning across disciplines, and growing into the creative you’re becoming.


Explore our core tracks:

-Filmmaking
-Design & Art
-Advertising
-Music & Sound
-Photography
-Content Creation
-Business for Creatives
-Tech Creative


This is your space to grow, connect, and lead. Book your ticket today!

الامن

description:
KALTHOUM – THE ANNIVERSARY TOUR

November - December 2025

Ibrahim Maalouf presents KALTHOUM, a tribute tour celebrating the 10th anniversary of the album of the same name.


Following a triumphant world tour in 2016, KALTHOUM returns for an exclusive series of 30 concerts across France and Europe.


The gold-certified album is an ambitious reinterpretation of one of the most iconic masterpieces by the Egyptian diva: "Alf Leila Wa Leila" (A Thousand and One Nights). Surrounded by a virtuoso jazz quintet, Ibrahim reimagines this legendary work, infusing it with depth and modernity, shaped by his own artistic sensitivity.


With KALTHOUM, Ibrahim not only honored a musical icon but also a major feminist and political figure whose legacy continues to resonate today.


"KALTHOUM is a celebration of women who have left their mark on history. I wanted to pay tribute to a voice that shaped my childhood and remains a monument for the Arab people." – Ibrahim Maalouf


Acclaimed upon its release, KALTHOUM captivated critics:
"An impressive and captivating cultural translation." – The New York Times
"An extraordinary dream factory." – Télérama
"A major success." – Jazzmania


In November and December 2025, Ibrahim Maalouf will bring this tribute back to the stage for an exceptional tour. Celebrating the 10th anniversary of the album and the 50th anniversary of the Star of the East's passing, this tour will grace prestigious venues, including Victoria Hall in Geneva, the Philharmonie of Luxembourg, and the Théâtre Femina in Bordeaux.
KALTHOUM promises to be the must-see musical journey of late 2025.
